title: Tryndamere
body:
I was playing a berserker in another game and started to think about Tryndamere and about his ultimate and I made three points...

**Point one:** Tryndamere is a berserker.

**Point two:** Berserkers are well known for having power at a disadvantage, like Olaf's E (damage if doesn't kill) and R (activation removes passive).

**Point three:** Tryndamere's ult has no down side to activation apart from not having it in the future and it's a very powerful ability (hourglass gives you invulnerability for 2.5 seconds and you can't move, attack or cast spells. Same with Bard's ult but that is an AoE).

So, with those three points in mind, do you think Riot should make Tryndamere's ultimate have a negative effect? Activating his Q has a negative effect as seen in losing critical strike chance (and possibly canceling the heal from his ultimate).

So, what do you think?

Because i hate tryndamere, im obviously going to vote negative effect, sorry trynd mains :( . Maybe like he dies after using it if he has taken a certain amount of damage? i mean, thematically it would make sense, as in, rage fills him and he gets enough strength to surive for 6 seconds, but if he takes 600/700/800 damage during the during the duration of his rage, he dies.

I had an idea myself going something like if he doesn't get a kill a portion (scaling down with level) of the damage he blocked would be dealt to him as true damage (and that damage would be as a tool-tip for him and others) giving the other team some counter-play in the regards of CC to stop him getting there and damage to kill him.
I reckon gutting his AD during his ult would be good
I think you've got a good point here but tryndamere is pretty weak anyway so if you were going to add in that negative effect then you would have to buff him in other areas.
